alert.note: Alert for Bitterroot, Sapphire Mountains; Lower Clark Fork Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued October 23 at 1:40PM MDT until October 26 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Flash freeze possible Wednesday morning. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 6 inches possible, except 7 to 10 inches in the higher terrain. Northeast wind 15 to 25 mph with gusts to 35 mph developing Tuesday night. * WHERE...Evaro Hill, Highway 200 Thompson Falls to Plains, Highway 93 Sula to Lost Trail Pass, Highway 200 Trout Creek to Heron, I-90 Lookout Pass to Haugan, and Lolo Pass * WHEN...From Tuesday evening through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Bitterroot, Sapphire Mountains; Lower Clark Fork Region
